questions.question: Which of the following statements about REST APIs in IoT platforms is true?
options: REST APIs are always required for real-time data communication in IoT.
REST APIs are useful for periodic data transfer but are not ideal for real-time messaging.
REST APIs replace the need for an IoT platformâ€™s message broker.
REST APIs work only for upstream applications and cannot be used by devices.

questions.question: Which layer in an IoT architecture is responsible for data filtering, analytics, and high-level decision-making?
options: Sensing and Actuating Layer
Network Layer
Middleware Layer
Application Layer

questions.question: Why is Mosquitto a common choice for an MQTT message broker in IoT platforms?
options: It is an open-source, lightweight, and stable implementation of MQTT.
It is the only message broker that supports real-time communication.
It eliminates the need for device authentication.
It does not require any additional configuration to work in production.

questions.question: What are valid reasons for using JSON as the standard payload format for MQTT messages in an IoT platform?
options: JSON is human-readable and easy to debug.
JSON enables binary data transmission with minimal overhead.
JSON ensures consistency and scalability across different devices.
JSON is the only format supported by MQTT.
None of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following are key drivers behind new IoT network architectures?
options: The need for low-latency and real-time processing.
The growing scale of IoT networks, often reaching millions of connected devices.
The elimination of cloud computing in favor of fully localized processing.
The demand for better security measures due to increased cyber threats.
None of the above.

questions.question: What are key benefits of the OpenFog Reference Architecture for IoT?
options: It reduces latency by enabling localized data processing.
It eliminates the need for cloud computing in IoT systems.
It improves system intelligence by distributing computational workloads.
It enhances reliability by reducing dependence on centralized cloud services.
None of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key limitation of mesh networks in IoT?
options: They require a direct Internet connection for every device.
They do not support multi-hop communication.
They suffer from low data throughput due to frequent message hopping.
They cannot be used for industrial applications.

questions.question: What is the primary function of edge computing in an IoT system?
options: To replace cloud computing entirely.
To provide low-latency data processing close to the IoT devices.
To store all IoT data permanently.
To connect all IoT devices directly to the Internet.

questions.question: What is the main function of the device manager in an IoT platform?
options: It ensures secure communication between devices and the cloud.
It manages devices, their status, access control, and over-the-air updates.
It processes raw sensor data into meaningful insights.
It routes messages between different IoT components.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a function of the message broker in an IoT platform?
options: Consolidating messages from different communication protocols.
Directly managing and controlling IoT devices.
Decoupling devices from the IoT platform.
Facilitating communication between different system components.

questions.question: Why is VLAN segmentation beneficial in IoT networks?
options: It isolates IoT devices from other network traffic to enhance security.
It eliminates the need for firewalls.
It forces all IoT devices to use the same communication protocol.
It removes the need for encryption in IoT communication.

questions.question: Which of the following statements correctly describe the role of an IoT platform?
options: It acts as a simple data storage for IoT applications.
It serves as the orchestrator of the entire IoT solution.
It only functions as a message router between devices and applications.
It is primarily responsible for ingesting, processing, and storing IoT data.
None of the above.

questions.question: Why do many IoT devices use gateways instead of connecting directly to the Internet?
options: Gateways are required to ensure secure communication between devices.
Many IoT devices use proprietary or short-range communication protocols that require translation.
Gateways provide unlimited bandwidth for IoT communications.
IoT devices cannot function without a gateway.

questions.question: Which of the following are key advantages of using a message broker in an IoT platform?
options: It ensures real-time bidirectional communication between devices and applications.
It functions as the primary storage for all IoT messages.
It allows asynchronous communication between components.
It eliminates the need for HTTP-based communication entirely.
None of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following reference architectures focus on standardizing IoT system development?
options: Industrial Internet Consortium Reference Architecture (IIRA)
OpenFog Reference Architecture
IoT-A Architectural Reference Model
ISO/IEC 30141 IoT Reference Architecture
None of the above.

questions.question: What are some key functions of IoT gateways/hubs?
options: Managing direct Internet connections for all edge devices.
Translating proprietary communication protocols into standard formats.
Aggregating and compressing data before transmission.
Preventing all types of security threats in IoT systems.
None of the above.

questions.question: What was a major outcome of the merger between the OpenFog Consortium and the Industrial Internet Consortium (IIC)?
options: The OpenFog architecture ceased to exist.
The IIC incorporated fog computing principles into its reference model.
The IIC discontinued all fog computing research.
Fog computing became the only acceptable IoT architecture.

questions.question: Which of the following best describe the role of APIs in an IoT platform?
options: APIs allow applications and devices to retrieve stored data.
APIs provide real-time communication directly between devices.
APIs enable integration with external services and applications.
APIs replace the need for a message broker.
None of the above.

questions.question: Which statement best differentiates an IoT solution from an IoT application?
options: An IoT application includes both hardware and software components.
An IoT solution is an end-to-end product or service, while an IoT application is usually just software-based.
IoT solutions do not involve software components, whereas IoT applications do.
IoT applications require physical sensors to function, whereas IoT solutions do not.

questions.question: Which security measures are commonly implemented in IoT routers and gateways?
options: Firewalls for network traffic filtering.
VLANs for network segmentation.
Open access to all devices to ensure seamless communication.
VPN tunnels for secure data transmission.
None of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following correctly describe the role of the Rule Engine in an IoT platform?
options: It listens to the message bus and executes actions based on predefined conditions.
It primarily handles the authentication of IoT devices.
It enhances the functionality of the communication management module.
It converts messages between different formats like CSV to JSON.
None of the above.

questions.question: What is a key reason why traditional IT architectures are not well-suited for IoT networks?
options: IT architectures focus on centralized processing, while IoT requires distributed architectures.
IT networks do not support IP-based communication.
IT networks are designed exclusively for cloud computing.
IT architectures are designed to handle massive amounts of sensor-generated data.

questions.question: Which characteristics differentiate IT networks from IoT networks?
options: IoT networks focus on data collection from distributed sensors, while IT networks prioritize business applications.
IT networks are designed for predictable traffic patterns, whereas IoT networks must handle unpredictable and bursty data flows.
IoT networks always use Ethernet as the primary communication technology.
IoT networks often operate in environments with constrained bandwidth and lossy networks.
None of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following best explains the need for an MQTT callback registration service in an IoT platform?
options: It ensures that all connected devices can store data locally.
It allows HTTP-based applications to receive real-time MQTT messages.
It replaces the need for time-series storage in the platform.
It encrypts messages before sending them to the database.

questions.question: Which of the following are key considerations when selecting an IoT edge gateway?
options: Support for multiple communication protocols such as MQTT, CoAP, and HTTP.
The ability to perform local data processing and filtering.
High power consumption to support continuous processing.
Security features such as encryption and authentication.
None of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following statements correctly describe the Industrial Internet Consortium Reference Architecture (IIRA)?
options: It is a framework for developing interoperable IoT systems across industries.
It provides detailed, low-level implementation guidelines.
It structures IoT systems using business, usage, functional, and implementation viewpoints.
It follows a three-tier architecture consisting of edge, platform, and enterprise layers.
None of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following are valid data access API functionalities in an IoT platform?
options: Querying historical data based on a time range.
Storing data that was not sent via MQTT.
Encrypting data before it is sent to the IoT platform.
Deleting stored data records based on conditions.
None of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following characteristics make MQTT suitable for IoT applications?
options: It minimizes network bandwidth usage.
It requires high processing power for message brokering.
It ensures low latency and reliable message delivery.
It operates best only on high-speed, stable networks.
None of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following are fundamental challenges in designing IoT networks?
options: Managing constrained devices with limited power, CPU, and memory.
Ensuring interoperability between different IoT communication protocols.
The necessity of direct connections between every IoT device and the cloud.
Implementing secure and scalable data transport mechanisms.
None of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following best describe the functions of failover in IoT networks?
options: It enables automatic switching between WAN interfaces during network disruptions.
It guarantees zero latency in IoT data transmissions.
It allows for redundancy in connectivity, such as switching from Wi-Fi to cellular.
It is only applicable to wired networks.
None of the above.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the oneM2M IoT Standardized Architecture?
options: It is a vertical-specific IoT model focusing only on smart home applications.
It provides a horizontal architecture to ensure interoperability across IoT domains.
It eliminates the need for cloud computing in IoT networks.
It was designed exclusively for 5G IoT deployments.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a perspective commonly considered in IoT system development?
options: Things-oriented view
Internet-oriented view
Semantic-oriented view
Entertainment-oriented view

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid function of microservice APIs in an IoT platform?
options: Handling email and text message notifications.
Providing authentication services for user access.
Managing MQTT message routing between devices.
Generating unique identifiers (UUIDs) for devices.

questions.question: What is a key challenge faced by large-scale IoT systems that reference architectures aim to address?
options: Eliminating the need for cloud computing.
Standardizing device interoperability and communication.
Ensuring that all IoT systems use the same programming language.
Replacing traditional computing systems with IoT-exclusive infrastructure.

questions.question: Why is the publish-subscribe mechanism preferred for IoT messaging over traditional HTTP requests?
options: It allows devices to push data even when the receiver is offline.
It requires a direct connection between sender and receiver at all times.
It ensures data is always delivered without any packet loss.
It prevents the need for any cloud-based infrastructure.
